name: Necrichor
condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.Legendary Resistance (2/Day): If the necrichor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
traits.Rejuvenation: Unless its lifeless remains are splashed with holy water or placed in a vessel under the effects of the hallow spell, the destroyed necrichor re-forms in 1d10 days, regaining all its hits points and appearing in the place it died or in the nearest unoccupied space.
traits.Spider Climb: The necrichor can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
traits.Unusual Nature: The necrichor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.Pseudopod: Melee Weapon Attack: +5+1d6 + 2 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14+1d6 + 11 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the start of the necrichor's next turn.
actions.Necrotic Bolt: Ranged Spell Attack: +6+1d6 + 3 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the necrichor's next turn.
actions.Blood Puppeteering (Recharge 6): The necrichor targets a creature it can see within 5 feet of it that is missing any of its hit points. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, it must succeed on a DC 14+1d6 + 11 Constitution saving throw or the necrichor enters the target's space and attaches itself to the target for 1 minute. While attached, the necrichor takes only half damage dealt to it (round down), and the target takes the remaining damage. The necrichor can attach to only one creature at a time.
